topic: Definition of generative AI|How it gathers information

matched_keywords: generative AI|deep learning|transformers|neural networks|attention mechanisms|training phase|generation process|GPT models|DALL-E|contextual relevance
evidence_spans: Generative AI is artificial intelligence designed to generate new content from learned patterns.|deep learning architectures like transformers or recurrent neural networks|training and generation phases|attention mechanisms to understand relationships|GPT models can generate coherent text|DALL-E creates images

Generative AI is a machine learning model trained to create new data that resembles its training data|During training, the neural network adjusts its internal parameters to recognize and replicate patterns in this data|For text models like ChatGPT, this means predicting one word at a time|This is why generative AI can create completely original content while still maintaining patterns from what it learned

matched_keywords: generative AI|transformer models|neural networks|ChatGPT|DALL-E|Jukebox|training data|pattern recognition|statistical prediction|token-by-token generation
evidence_spans: Generative AI refers to AI systems that can generate new content such as text, images, audio, or video based on patterns from training data|core mechanism involves large neural networks, particularly transformer models|Examples like ChatGPT for text, DALL-E for images, and Jukebox for music all follow this general principle|generative AI uses this learned knowledge to generate output token-by-token or element-by-element

Generative AI is artificial intelligence that can create new content in various formats by learning from existing data|neural networks with many interconnected layers|the generation process works like this: you input a prompt, the model processes it through its learned neural network, and produces output by predicting likely continuations|training data teaches the model probability distributions it can sample from
